messages.title: Vote Labour for a better Britain
messages.content: Our schools, NHS and social care services are at breaking point under the Tories. Many people are struggling to keep their homes while the rich get tax breaks. Vote Labour on 8 June for a country run for the many, not the few.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We'll give the NHS and social care services the money they need - money they have been starved of since 2010.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Every child the chance to succeed
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We shall open new grammar schools for free schools, and giving all schools the money they need to provide good education for every child.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protect wages and create good jobs
keyPolicies.policyDescription: An end to zero hours contracts, promotion of workers’ right, and a real Living Wage of £10 an hour.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Affordable homes to rent and buy
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will build one million new homes, 50 percent of them for affordable rent.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Co-operative relationship with Europe after Brexit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We promise that EU citizens already here can stay, and that we’ll get good deals on trade, justice, science, and travel.

issues.brexitEurope: We promise that EU citizens already here can stay, and that we’ll get good deals on trade, justice, science, and travel.
issues.economy: An end to zero hours contracts, promotion of workers’ right, and a real Living Wage of £10 an hour.

contactInformation.address: 9 Birkdale Court, Fornham St. Martin, Suffolk IP28 6XF

endorsements.endorser: Giti Dunham, Local resident, Bury St. Edmunds
endorsements.endorsement: I will vote for Labour in the general election because I believe in a society that places its priorities in justice, equality and compassion for the weak and vulnerable.

images.caption: Austerity is hardest on women and families

examples: Nurses' pay has fallen by 14 per cent since 2010.
Labour will build one million new homes.
Labour will give the NHS the money it needs.
Our schools, NHS and social care services are at breaking point under the Tories.
Many people are struggling to keep their homes while the rich get tax breaks.
Tories are the party of the few not the many.
Austerity is hardest on women and families.
Labour will build one million new homes, 50 percent of them for affordable rent.
We'll give the NHS and social care services the money they need - money they have been starved of since 2010.
We promise that EU citizens already here can stay, and that we’ll get good deals on trade, justice, science, and travel.
An end to zero hours contracts, promotion of workers’ right, and a real Living Wage of £10 an hour.

I will vote for Labour in the general election because I believe in a society that places its priorities in justice, equality and compassion for the weak and vulnerable. - Giti Dunham, Local resident, Bury St. Edmunds
Our schools, NHS and social care services are at breaking point under the Tories.
The Tories can't fix Britain’s housing crisis - since 2010 housebuilding has fallen to its lowest peacetime level since the 1920s.
